cs.SI, cs.SOC, cs.DS, cs.DM, cs.CC. 

The paper deals with the spread of influence in social networks, which is a topic that falls under the intersection of computer science and social sciences. The paper also mentions graph theory and approximation algorithms, which are common topics in computer science. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) and cs.SOC (Computational Social Science). The paper also mentions the NP-hardness of the problem, which suggests that it belongs to the sub-categories cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) and cs.DM (Discrete Mathematics). Finally, the paper discusses the convergence properties of the algorithms, which suggests that it belongs to the sub-category cs.CC (Computational Complexity).
